oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-03-08 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 8, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys (including Howdy Forrester, June Webb, and Bashful Brother Oswald), guest performers the Wilburn Brothers, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Minnie Pearl, and Pap's Jug Band. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 961st broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Minnie Pearl; Wilburn Brothers; Bashful Brother Oswald; June Webb; Pap's Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Roy Acuff talks -- Shake My Mother's Hand For Me (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, June Webb, Wilburn Brothers) -- Roy Acuff introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Roy Acuff, Wilburn Brothers) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Roy Acuff and Grant Turner introduce the Wilburn Brothers -- My Baby Ain't My Baby No More (Wilburn Brothers) -- Roy Acuff introduces Bashful Brother Oswald -- Long Journey Home (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Sugartime (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, June Webb, Pap's Jug Band, Wilburn Brothers) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Pap's Jug Band; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Bashful Brother Oswald; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Webb, June, 1934-; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Wilburn Brothers
